name_japanese: カッくんカフェ
description:
Kakuei Kakkun Tanaka is a superhero who hangs out with his friends. In his misadventures, he becomes prime minister of Japan, visits New York and prevents a nuclear war.

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

name_japanese: かこパッド ー長岡花火物語ー
description:
An educational web anime where an apathetic elementary student Yukita, who is visiting his grandfather along with his sister, clicks a mysterious app on his KakoPad. The two children are suddenly teleported back to August 1, 1945--the same date as the Nagaoka air raid.

The Nagaoka Fireworks Festival was founded in 1946. The event is in remembrance of those who died in WW2, specifically with the three shiragiku (white chrysanthemum fireworks) launched. The anime itself was commissioned by the foundation that organizes the Nagaoka Fireworks Festival. In 2003 and onward, the fireworks officially starts at 10:30pm, the same time the bombing began; and the duration of the short is 10min30sec long as well to mirror this very important time.

name_japanese: 格言! かくざ 父さん
description: The third season of of the Kakuza Tousan franchise.

name_japanese: 核戦争　学習アニメーション
description: An educational anime about nuclear war.

name_japanese: 核戦争
description: An educational film about nuclear warfare and the effects it has on the environment as told by a talking frog.

name_japanese: かくざ父さん
description:
A stop-motion comedy drama about sugar cube people from the Meiji era. Specifically it focuses on the father Kakuza who easily succumbs to emotion usually about his 37 year old daughter Touko's newest fiancé who tries to ask for his blessing. He's scared of losing his daughter even though it was his late wife's dying wish to see her as a happy bride. 

The show had a very irregular release schedule and by the end of its serialization its title had changed to Kakugen! Kakuza Tousan.

name_japanese: かくざ父さん
description: DVD specials of Kakuza Tousan. The first episode has a musician lemon and balloon fight for Touko's affection. The second episode has a French speaking sugar stick packet as the fiancé of an oddly young Touko.

name_japanese: 釜石の“奇跡”～いのちを守る特別授業～
description: An awareness special covering the 2011 Touhoku earthquake and tsunami based on real people in the Kamaishi region; which was the region hit with the tallest tsumami wave.

name_japanese: 仮面のマリオネットたち
description:
Screened at the 1st Sogetsu Animation Festival in 1965, the film was made in 35mm using the animation equipment owned by animator Yoji Kuri.

(Source: Collaborative Cataloging Japan)

name_japanese: 仮面の忍者赤影
description:
Red Shadow, created by Mitsuteru Yokoyama, is a ninja who wears a red-and-black costume and a stylized red mask. His adventures take place in Feudal Japan, and he and his ninja sidekicks Aokage and Shirokage fight evil warlords, wizards and daikaiju using modern high-tech gadgetry (a blatant oddity in a period setting).

(Source: Wikipedia)

name_japanese: 仮面ライダーゼロワン ショートアニメ EVERYONE’S DAILY LIFE
description: Kamen Rider Zero-One shorts released on the Toei Tokusatsu Fanclub (TTFC) app.

name_japanese: 紙の上のパイロット
description: Official music video for Kami no Ue no Pilot where a girl and boy bond over airplanes.

name_japanese: かみのみかくし
description: Official music video project by Studio Guiana titled Kami nomi Kakushi.

name_japanese: 神々の記
description:
Set during 3000 BCE in the Nile region of Egypt, Kamigami no Ki ("Chronicles of the Gods") will depict the comical misadventures of Bastet, Anubis, Ra, and the mysterious ghost Medjedo as well as their caretakers, Iabi and Ahkeu.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

name_japanese: 神々の記 Xmas特別編
description: A Christmas special of Kamigami no Ki "aired" between episode 4 and 5. It was a web only release.

name_japanese: カミナリ坊やピカッ太君の自転車教室
description: A bicycle safety anime starring the cast of Kaminari Boy Pikkari★bee.

name_japanese: カミナリ坊やピカッ太君の交通安全
description: A traffic safety anime starring the cast of Kaminari Boy Pikkari★bee.

name_japanese: かみなり坊やピッカリ★ビー
description:
A comedy about a mischievous boy. Each episode contains 2 stories.

Based on a manga by Murotani Tsunezou.

(Source: AniDB)

name_japanese: かみさまみならい ヒミツのここたま 特别篇
genres: Slice of Life, Kids, Magic, Fantasy
description: Short episodes that introduce the Cocotama's from Kirakira Happy★Hirake! Cocotama TV series.

name_japanese: 映画 かみさまみならい ヒミツのここたま 奇跡をおこせ♪テップルとドキドキここたま界
description:
Kokoro's school is teaming up with another to form a bazaar so they can sell/re-home gently used items everyone no longer uses around their homes. On her way from from school Tama Elder tells her that she and her Cocotama friends won a trip to the Cocotama World. Here they see how full fledged Cocotama gods work. Elder Tama asks for Kokoro's help in helping humans realize the value of their items instead of so easily tossing them away. But Tepple had snuck into the Cocotama world with the others and taken a key acorn which unlocks the Happy Tree that contains Happy Stars, the source of magic for their world. Elder Tama found out it was missing and the Cocotama gang try to track it down. He says that mushrooms are appearing on tossed away items that as they are born from the feelings of sadness, and they emit a negative energy that effects both humans and Cocotama. Cocotama can get rid of them but not without the acorn and not at the speed humans are currently discarding items at.

Tepple uses the acorn to take a Happy Star but inadvertently causes a rift of darkness and an infestation of mushrooms in Cocotama World. And Happy Stars begin spilling out into the human world draining all magic out. Kokoro and the Cocotama must heal Tepple's heart before the darkness consumes the human world.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ
description: The first series from the GiftMovie Project, which was aired in between theater commercials at all 57 TOHO Cinemas theaters. It features a rabbit called Rope and his senpai squirrel Akira, and their long, disrupted way to the movie theater.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロぺ＆鷹の爪コラボ　映像編
description: A collaboration between Kamiusagi Rope, Taka no Tsume, and TOHO Cinemas.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ
description: Random ONAs of Kamiusagi Rope. Most are one-shot web collaborations or commercials, these shorts were not included in any DVD release of Kamiusagi Rope hence why they are bundled together for this entry rather than having their own independent entries. If a collaboration has multiple eps (eg. Tire Kan, au, Takarakuji, etc.) it will receive its own entry instead of being included here.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ２
description: The sequel to Kamiusagi Rope; it also aired in between commercials at theaters.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ２ Specials
description: Chronologically the 10th, 12th, 13th, and 16th eps that were never shown in theaters. They were released on DVD before and were shown on TV 3 years after the main 2nd season aired in theaters.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ3
description: 3rd season of Kamiusagi Rope.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ3
description:
Two ONA specials of Kamiusagi Rope.

Feng Shui: Rope and Akira run into their friend's mother.

Undou Shinkei: Akira and Rope tries flying a kite, although it ends up stuck in a tree.

name_japanese: 映画「紙兎ロペ」 Episode 0
description: A special episode made for the Kamiusagi Rope Movie premiere. It features paper squirrel Akira's older sister, who has trouble with choosing which earrings to wear for her date.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ 温暖化
description: Chronologically these are 13th and 15th episodes of the 1st series included on the DVD release in 2011.

name_english: Paper Rabbit Rope Wait Last One For Summer Vacation For Real!?
name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ　つか、夏休みラスイチってマジっすか！？
description: An actual movie of the Kamiusagi Rope series, featuring Rope and Akira, as they experience a thrilling adventure in their downtown.

name_english: Paper Rabbit Rope x AU Collaboration
name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ　AUコラボEP
description: A collaborative advertisement between Kamiusagi Rope and au (a Japanese mobile phone company), where Rope and Akira interact with modern cellular technology.

name_english: Paper Rabbit Rope x Panasonic Collaboration
name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ　パナソニックコラボEP
description: A collaborative advertisement video between Kamiusagi Rope and Panasonic, where Rope and Akira interact with Panasonic's new surround headphones.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ x Ricordi
description: A collaboration between the Kamiusagi Rope franchise and the real estate company Ricordi.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ×ROPÉ SISTERS
description: A collaboration between the Kamiusagi Rope anime franchise and ROPÉ a Japanese fashion brand for the brand's 50th anniversary of its three sister fashion lines.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ  TOHOシネマズ
description: Kamiusagi Rope and TOHO Cinemas collaboration episodes that were released online only.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ  TOHOシネマズ
description:
Kamiusagi Rope episodes for TOHO Cinemas that aired between theater commercials. Most are collaborations or advertisements and they are not considered to be a part of the movie series (ie. Kamiusagi Rope, Kamiusagi Rope 2, Kamiusagi Rope 3) due to being advertisements as well as having an irregular releases.

Some were shown at all TOHO Cinemas (eg. Kashiwa was shown everywhere to advertise the new Kashiwa TOHO Cinemas opening the following month) while others were regional restricted (eg. Hissawwaza was shown only in TOHO Cinemas Shinjuku in honor of the theater's grand opening as well as being a collaboration with the Godzilla franchise and Tokyo Metro's new IC Touch campaign).

None of these episodes were released online at a later date nor included in any DVD release of Kamiusagi Rope.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ×東京ガス
description: A collaboration between Kamiusagi Rope and Tokyo Gas promoting a special gas exhibition campaign.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ × ワコール
description: Collaboration episodes between the undergarment brand Wacoal and the comedy anime franchise Kamiusagi Rope.

name_japanese: 紙兎ロペ 〜笑う朝には福来たるってマジっすか!?
description: Fourth season of Kamiusagi Rope, events occur after the feature film. Airs on Mezamashi TV instead of the theaters.

name_japanese: カミワザ・ワンダ
description:
The story is set in a world where every event has been turned into programs, and mysterious monsters known as "Promin" maintain the world. However, many Promin who have turned into bugs known as "Bugmin" are responsible for many of the world's real-life bugs. Left alone, they may eventually turn into a big problem. The boy Yuuto encounters the space dog Wanda, and the pair use a camera-like device and key items to capture Bugmin. Promin themselves are able to do things like "accelerate objects," "spew fire," or "create objects," through an ability known as "Kamiwaza" (miracle), and are able to fend off Bugmin with it. At first, the Bugmin only cause small, bothersome things, but it will soon elevate into a global scale threat. Can one boy and one dog save the world?

(Source: ANN)

name_japanese: 鴨が好き
description: One sunny afternoon, a middle-aged man goes on a walk to feed some ducks.

name_japanese: かもとりごんべえ
description: A puppet animated film based on a folk tale of the same name.

name_japanese: かむかもしかもにどもかも！
description: Music video for the song Kamu Kamo Shikamo Nidomo Kamo! by the band MONO NO AWARE that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. The video was animated by Takashi Ohashi.

name_japanese: かな かな かな
description: An official "Minna no Uta" music video for Saori Yuki's song Kana Kana ka na.

name_japanese: かなかなかぞく
description: An original anime series created in cooperation with Kanagawa Prefecture.

name_japanese: かなかなかぞくショートなる早拡散希望!!
description: Kana Kana Kazoku CMs using new animation.

name_japanese: かなかなかぞく「秘密結社 鷹の爪コラボムービー」
description: No synopsis information has been added to this title. Help improve our database by adding a synopsis here.

name_japanese: かなかなかぞくボイスドラマ「リカ イン ワンダーランド」
description: Kana Kana Kazoku picture drama style Alice in Wonderland interpretation of Kanagawa Prefecture's tourism sights.

name_japanese: かなかなかぞく　新年のごあいさつ
description: A New Year's special for Kana Kana Kazoku, welcoming the 2015 year.

name_japanese: かなかなかぞく「ストップ風しん」
description: A public service special for rubella vaccines. Most of this episode recycles the animation sequences from episode 5 of Kana Kana Kazoku but new dialogue is put in.
